subject: Business
title: Financial Independence: The FIRE Movement
description: One-minute skill: Financial Independence: The FIRE Movement.

hook.text: A 32-year-old software engineer retires with $1.2 million. Not because she's rich â€” because she needs less.

buildup.text: FIRE (Financial Independence, Retire Early) means saving aggressively so investment income covers living expenses.

discovery.text: The 4% rule: if annual expenses are 4% or less of your portfolio, you can withdraw indefinitely without running out.

twist.text: FIRE isn't about deprivation. It's about aligning spending with values and rejecting mindless consumption.

climax.text: With $1M invested and $40K annual expenses, you never need to work for money again. The math is simple.

punchline.text: Financial independence isn't about never working.

quiz.question: What is the 4% rule in the FIRE movement?
options: You can withdraw 4% of your portfolio annually without running out of money
You should save 4% of your income each month
Investment returns must exceed 4% to retire
